court.translation[0].definitions[0].sign: for deciding about a legal case
court.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty
court.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: It could not be proved in a court of law.
The court case lasted six weeks.
Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
The court ruled that no compensation was due.
She threatened to take the magazine to court (=take legal action against them) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
court.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an area made for playing games such as tennis
court.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Can you book a squash court for tomorrow?
The players are due on court in an hour.
court.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the place where a king or queen lives and works
court.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the king, queen, their family, and their friends, advisers etc
court.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Several members of the court were under suspicion.
There was a taste in court circles for romantic verse.
court.translation[0].note_box[0].section: You may be asked to give evidence before a court of law.
a recent court case involving the death of a baby
A court order specified that the money must be paid back over six months.
The company appealed against the court ruling.
He was threatened with court action.
The court proceedings were over in a day.
The costs of going to court are very high.
She took the company to court for sex discrimination.
Three teenage girls were brought before the court for robbing an elderly woman.
A man has appeared in court charged with cruelty to animals.
a case comes to court/comes before the court
The case came to court 21 months later.
The county court will hear the case next month.
The matter was finally settled out of court.
The court ruled that the penalty was not excessive.
A US court cleared him of bribery allegations.
A New York court convicted her as a tax cheat.
It seems likely that the court will uphold his conviction.
A Brazilian court has quashed a 19-year jail sentence.
a court adjourns a case/trial etc
The court adjourned the trial until June 21st.
The court dismissed his appeal against conviction.
Two French magistrates ruled that he should stand trial in a criminal court.
Eviction proceedings take place in a civil court.
The defendant went to the Crown Court for sentencing.
Their convictions were upheld in the High Court.
The appeals court rejected the defence’s argument.
Thomas was the only African-American justice on the Supreme Court.
The army reportedly held kangaroo courts and executed alleged rebels.
court.translation[0].note_box[1].section: the person who is on trial for a crime
the lawyers who are working for the defendant
the lawyers who are trying to prove that the defendant is guilty
the official in charge of a court who decides how criminals should be punished
a group of people, usually 12 people, who listen to the facts and decide whether the defendant is guilty or not guilty
someone who describes in a court of law what he or she knows about a crime
a formal statement made in a court of law about a particular situation or action
the decision of the jury as to whether the defendant is guilty or not guilty
court.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to try hard to please someone, especially because you want something from them
court.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: His campaign team have assiduously courted the media.
court.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if a man courts a woman, he spends time being nice to her because he hopes to marry her
court.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the people in a court, especially the judge, other officials, and the JURY (=ordinary people who decide certain cases). The phrase is often used when talking about what a judge or jury think or decide about a case
court.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The court said the defendants had been denied a fair trial.
court.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a place where all the information concerning a crime or disagreement is given so that it can be judged
court.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The new laws haven’t yet been tested in court.
Sexual harassment is a criminal offense in Germany, but few women complain or go to court (=start the legal process to have a case dealt with in court).
Federal authorities are free to take taxpayers to court to collect unpaid taxes.
The two sides agreed to settle the case out of court (=without asking the court to make a decision).
court.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to behave nicely towards someone because you want them to do something for you or you want to get something from them
court.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: A distinguished chemist, Ed Alexander has been courted by large corporations, but he stays in the classroom doing what he loves - teaching.
The EU is being courted by a number of countries putting themselves forward as the best suppliers of energy.
court.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: if one company courts another, it has discussions with the other company about the possibility of a friendly takeover or MERGER (=combining the companies)
court.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: While only Daimler-Benz has courted the luxury car company in public, Volkswagen is also said to be interested in buying it.
